intro: Verticordia serrata var. linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved feather-flower, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, serrated leaves. The plant produces striking, feather-like inflorescences that range in color from pink to red, depending on the season. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in heathland environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
